website_summaries.verdict: Though this kit does not analyze your dog's health, its breed database is impressive.
pros: Results are available in 2 to 4 weeks
Returns results for breeds as low as 5% of total composition
Can be upgraded at any time to include genetic health profile
cons: Somewhat pricey for a test that does not include health information

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love knowing all the breeds that went into the creation of my dog. She was a rescue so there was no telling what all was mixed in. She was simply "australian cattle dog" But come to find out she has a german shepherd way back in her history. Sure explains the size of her ears!
customer_reviews.author: Ydain

customer_reviews.title: The More You Know the Better!
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny! Everyone thought my rescue puppy was a Rottweiler or a Doberman mix, or even a hound, but they were all wrong! And trainers were addressing my puppy's training as if she would have the temperament of a Rottweiler. Well she is 60% Border Collie, 20% Australian Shepherd and 20% Labrador Retriever and she fits this mix and it all makes sense including her character and behaviors! I'm so glad I made this purchase! Training has been adapted to deal with her intelligent breed mix; and her flea and heartworm prevention was changed to take into consideration meds not recommended for collies.
customer_reviews.author: JKing

customer_reviews.title: Fascinating Information about our  new pup!
customer_reviews.text: We ended up with the full version of the product, and it is amazing how much info the results provide. A comprehensive 28 page report was provided! We thought our rescue dog was a Jack Russell, but it turns out she is 27% pitbull, and about 10 other breeds to lower percentages. The provide a nice family tree type chart, showing parents, grandparents, and great grandparents, health condition screening, wolfiness percentage, and several other things. Highly recommended. We did a lot of research, and this particular brand is considered the best and most comprehensive.
customer_reviews.author: RHODY401

customer_reviews.title: Not sure...
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure the results were what I expected. My little guy is obviously half “wiener dog” but that didn’t even come up as a breed. The rescue had his mom I n their care when she had her puppies. Maybe just a bad swab. Not sure.
customer_reviews.author: Njjee

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, seriously
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, finally know what Apollo is. I didn't send in a picture before. Legit! They gave a free upgrade to the better pack too.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Cervoni

customer_reviews.title: Activation Code Invalid, Embark Customer Support Ignoring Me
customer_reviews.text: I received a kit and activation code and sent it off. When I tried to link it to my test kit, the code was not accepted (bought on Amazon). I have contacted Embark’s customer service, who promised to figure it out, but 13 days later and it seems like they couldn’t care less about figuring it out. I would recommend trying any other brand at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Larcombe

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I have a very unique looking dog I rescued from Puerto Rico and thought it would be wonderful to find out a few of his breeds, considering he's definitely a mutt. Well needless to say the embark was super easy to use & its results are adorable BUT ITS COMPLETELY INACCURATE. My dog was 23%chihuahua & 21% American Eskimo 13% pomeranian. Ok great except MY DOG IS HAIRLESS, with brown skin & pink spots. Nice try embark but even my dog disagrees.
customer_reviews.author: Jesso77

customer_reviews.title: Yup he's a poodle
customer_reviews.text: We rescued a poodle mix which to use looks like a poodle, but when out on walks when we'd run into another poodle we did see a lot of differences. His hair is poofy and never mats even if I don't brush it. He had longer legs and body than other poodles and his tail is more wire-y. Turns out he's 70% small poodle, and 14% pomeranian, 15% unresolved. Based on the family tree, the pomeranian is likely a great grandparent. I guess it makes sense for the poofy but non matting hair! Either way this was fun to know.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best test, don’t bother with the cheaper competitor
customer_reviews.text: We adopted an adorable mutt from the shelter and were dying to know her background. We originally bought the competitors test and was super disappointed when it came back with more than 60% “unknown”. I almost gave up on the process but decided to give Embark a try. The test was very thorough and the turnaround time was quick. So happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie B

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: I did not think the results were accurate. I contacted them with no reply.
customer_reviews.author: Sholey

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE!!! HAVE CONTACTED AND NO RESPONSE!
customer_reviews.text: We got back a 100% Biewer Terrier. There is absolutely NO way this dog is a pure breed dog. Description says should be 7-8” tall & less than 8 lbs. He is 17 lbs and his legs are 7-8” tall! VERY DISAPPOINTED IN THIS PRODUCT FOR THE PRICE!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy G

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: This was completely inaccurate. My dog looks like a lab puppy with a long wiener-type body (all white lab-type fur and spots on his floppy ears). He’s 23 lbs. They told me he was a chihuahua, yorkie, and small poodle. He’s bigger than all those dogs, none have the wiener shaped body like he does, all have different ears and different coats... it just clearly wasn’t accurate. If at least a dachshund was listed on there I’d maybe consider the others, but none of what they listed have his distinctive body type. It’s a lot of money for completely inaccurate results.
customer_reviews.author: ee

customer_reviews.title: Embark will not respond to my 'chihuahua' complaint.
customer_reviews.text: Lucy is my 25-pound fur kid that I would have bet was a Bassett Hound/Dachsund mix...big floppy ears, short stocky legs and a face like a German Shepard...so when the test results indicated she was 'mostly Chihuahua', I suspected I was 'mostly scammed'. It's followed up w/emails begging me to 'upgrade' to a health analysis, which I bet will show Lucy has an Identity Disorder. I also have a Chihuahua, and no, I did not swab the wrong mouth, but I sure don't see ANY resemblance in looks or temperament. It may be accurate for some, not for Lucy.
customer_reviews.author: PithyWoman

customer_reviews.title: Now we will Never know.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my daughter. She sent the sample DNA to the company as per instructions. She received an email that they had received her sample. A week to 2 weeks later my daughter received notice that something must have happened to the sample and they could no longer use it. They asked her to please submit another sample. Well as life would have it, the poor dog passed away in those few weeks We are very disappointed that the sample was somehow compromised and now we will never know what my daughters cute, very smart little dog was. :(
customer_reviews.author: Carol S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellet dog DNA product
customer_reviews.text: Embark is fairly priced (you get what you pay for), easy to use, we were kept informed at every step of the way, and we believe the results were very accurate. All this time we thought our little Sally was a mix of Shitzu Zu and Maltese - turns out she's Bichon and Pekinese! And she's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: T.J. Griffin

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were easy to follow and didn't seem to bother my dog much. I haven't received my test results yet, but embark sends updates as the product is shipped, received, and when testing has begun with detailed explanations along the way.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Z.

customer_reviews.title: Completely inaccurate results
customer_reviews.text: The results came back and said my dog was half pit bull, half boxer. My sister has a half pit bull, half boxer and has zero resemblance to my dog. I did research on the internet and I'm nearly 100% certain my dog is a "bordenese" (border collie, Burnese mountain dog mix). Look it up for yourself and you'll see what I'm talking about. I do not trust the science of these tests based on my results.
customer_reviews.author: Jason K

customer_reviews.title: Purchase directly from website and search for coupon codes
customer_reviews.text: This company frequently has discount codes for their kits. I was not aware of that when I purchased my kit, which was apparently only for dog DNA. The company frequently offers the dna PLUS health for the same price as amazon sells just the DNA kit (you just need to search for discount codes). The kit was awesome, and I was super excited to learn what my girl was mixed with, but I eventually ended up spending more money to upgrade to the health kit as well (because curiosity killed the cat and dog owners love their dogs). So I would recommend researching the company directly through their website before purchasing this kit through amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Serena valley

customer_reviews.title: Registration code doesn’t work (2 bought) ..... Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money. I can’t tell you how good this product is because the registration code doesn’t work. I sent the first box back and the second one sent has the same problem. I contacted the company 7 days ago and no response. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Very easy test to do and send in.
customer_reviews.text: I chose Embark because of the reviews I read from my social group of dog owners. They all said that Embark offers the most value for the money in that they not only test for DNA but all for health issues. It was easy to administer and send back and they have been in touch with me from the time of receipt. I am looking forward to getting the results for our Zoe.
customer_reviews.author: joanne kenny

customer_reviews.title: Most Happy!
customer_reviews.text: Got "Boomer" from the humane society. He was listed as a doberman mix. I've had him since September. Results were...drum roll...100% Catahoula Leopard dog (black and tan variety)! After reading their temperament the fog has lifted...I joke "no wonder you act the way you do!" Now that I know his traits I understand him better and it gives me insight on how to work with him best! So with that being said getting the results is invaluable!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: super easy to use, most accurate test on the market
customer_reviews.text: it was super easy to use, came really fast and the instructions were really easy. my puppy didn't mind it, didn't hurt her at all, just a cheek swab and you're done! the results came in less than a month which is awesome, they have two test options, one that is DNA and health panel and one without the health panel. will defiantly get for all the dogs ill adopt in the future.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Happy I finally know what Ben probably is
customer_reviews.text: Pretty straightforward to use. I've got a "beagle mix" that is 0% beagle! He's apparently 33% wiener dog, 32% rat terrier (I was surprised it wasn't higher) 17% poodle. I can see rat terrier for sure, never would have guessed wienie or POODLE. Looks nothing like a poodle mix but he is super soft so maybe that's something. Makes me a bit skeptical about the accuracy of the results, but I understand that there are recessive and dominant genes so its probably accurate. He's mixed with a lot of different breeds so I'm very happy that they were able to identify all but 7% of him, that's better than the reviews of other tests.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: I don’t think they got it right. My dog is a 30lb scruffy dog that looks like a terrier. Results came back all large breeds that don’t look anything like my dog. My vet agreed it cannot be accurate. I sent embark an email and it went unanswered.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Likely a scam, but not sure
customer_reviews.text: I want to warn people that ( my opinion completely, and some veterinarian's, too). Pet DNA tests, like this one, are fun, but a TOTAL SCAM. They ask you for a description of your dog, and you can send a pic if you wish. You get multiple emails with offers to upgrade to a health analysis. When your results come back, they "could possibly be " your pup, but it is rarely what you've seen in your dog. I'm highly skeptical of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Riley

customer_reviews.title: She’s not a mutt
customer_reviews.text: I rescued my dog from a shelter as a “mix”. She didn’t look like a mix. She’s 💯 German Shepherd. The kit was fun and amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Janet L

customer_reviews.title: If you need to know!
customer_reviews.text: Denver was a rescue and he had all these little things about him that we just wondered where they came from. Turns out he was a full blooded Mal-shih. Truly a designer dog! The DNA gave us information about his great grandparents which were both Maltese his grandparents which were Mal-Shih and his parents who were also Mal-Shih. So it was neat to find out where his short legs and his personality traits came from!
customer_reviews.author: Anne D.

customer_reviews.title: Waist of money
customer_reviews.text: I would have given zero stars if that was possible! The results are way out of line!.... I have a Labradoodle. I personally know the parents, as well as the grandparents.... the grand mother is a AKC registered black Lab..... grand father as well as mother are AKC registered standard poodles....Dad is the offspring of the lab and poodle.....So my dog is an F1B Labradoodle...... My dog's DNA came back showing poodle, pit bull, parinese, ............absolutely zero Labrador Retriever haha not possible!
customer_reviews.author: KL Morris

customer_reviews.title: Not very decisive on breed identification.  Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This is the second DNA test I have used for my dog with only one breed in common to the first DNA test. Almost a quarter of his DNA is labeled "super mut". I know for certain that his mother is an Australian Kelpie, but this breed did not show up. Maybe there needs to be more research done before this kind of testing works.
customer_reviews.author: sm

customer_reviews.title: Don't think it's accurate
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to find out what my adopted "mutt's" breed was. The whole process was easy and they communicated every step of the way and I even got the results sooner than expected. But, I don't believe the results were very accurate. I've attached a photo of the dog we tested. The tests came back 42.6% Chinese Shar-Pei. Can you see that breed in him, because I sure can't. I hated I spent $100 on this just to be disappointed. I could have believed almost any other breed, but that one.
customer_reviews.author: jesjoh

customer_reviews.title: Get to know your critter's family tree!
customer_reviews.text: Results are fairly quick. Found out my little girl was 27% American Pitbull Terrier. Surprise to me! Other major genes were Doberman, Australian Cattle Dog, Lab, GSD and Chow Chow. She's got traits and physical attributes from them all now that she's growing. Very interesting and informative. You can even see dogs that are closely related to your dog, sibling, 1st cousins, second... you know what I mean. Nice to know what breed's blood is running thru their veins... helps with training. Very happy with purchase!
customer_reviews.author: PUMA

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Meet Bruno. When I adopted him I was told he was half Bloodhound and half Bluetick Coonhound. I knew he had the Bloodhound in him but I always questioned the other half. I purchased Embark DNA test and went to work! Very easy to use from start to finish. Then the waiting game began. I was kept up to date throughout the whole process via emails. The results came in as follows: 59.3% Bloodhound 20.4 % Treeing Walker Coonhound 20.3% American Foxhound I couldn't be more happier that I choose Embark with the simplicity of the process and I would recommend this product to anyone who is looking to confirm the breed of their dog !!
customer_reviews.author: Joe T

customer_reviews.title: I can’t believe I paid money for this 🤔
customer_reviews.text: 4 weeks later.. 100% pitbull terrier. “pitbull” ISNT EVEN A BREED!! My dog is fully grown at 27 lbs and looks like a whippet.. she’s obviously a “pit mix” but I thought the point of the test was to get some more specific info .. really disappointed to be told exactly what I already knew. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Reebsicle

customer_reviews.title: The test failed twice, so far.
customer_reviews.text: I am a bit frustrated in the process so far. I followed the directions exactly the 1st time. The 2nd time I swabbed the inside of my dogs cheek/jowel twice as long! It wasn't a pleasant experience for my dog to have me twirling a swab in his mouth for that long! It still failed to provide enough DNA! Yes, I had treats in view. No, he hadn't eaten or drank (actually for 8 and a 1/2 hours) before. I will try again, but I am not as excited or hopeful. I am concerned that this will be a waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: Aquarium lover

customer_reviews.title: I was a skeptic but it’s accurate!
customer_reviews.text: Have to admit I was a skeptic. I choose to disclose as little information as possible because I wanted to make sure it was accurate. I knew my dog was part beagle because of the distinct bark and size but everyone and I thought he was also terrier... I was shocked to find he wasn’t but boxer. It was very enlightening! And a lot of fun waiting in anticipation for the results which didn’t take long at all. Highly recommend if you have a rescue pup!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Powell

customer_reviews.title: NOT SATISFIED
customer_reviews.text: This product is very expensive. Mars Wisdom #2 gave me more information, including weight prediction and basic health issues as well as breed determination. Embark was limited to breed determination. For the price of $129 vs $79 for Mars Wisdom #2, it was not worth it. When I called to at least get a weight prediction, I was told that was an "upgrade of extra $99" for trait and health. Very pricey. Will not use again as I am an animal rescuer and use a DNA test a lot. Will not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: miriecho

customer_reviews.title: Experts in what they do.
customer_reviews.text: We were surprised at the level of customer service and communication from Embark. They let you know every step of the way where the sample was in process and the results were perfect to what we expected. Our boy is a rescue and they only had the swab to ID him. We are over the top with positive things to say about our experience.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Preston

customer_reviews.title: Accurate for Mutts
customer_reviews.text: I think this is extremely accurate!! Our dog was labeled as a German shepherd at the animal shelter, but I always knew he had pitbull in him!! The test did take about 5 months to result, so I recommend not to buy it around Christmas time (If you want quick results). I’m assuming they had a ton of tests to do. I’m still happy with this test overall and my mom loved it as a gift!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent communication!
customer_reviews.text: This was a very easy test to do. The company was amazing as far as communicating with me. The results were interesting, the highest percentage of one bread was 21%. My husband was disappointed with the results he thought there should have been more detail. Of course, if you paid more you might get that. It gave us an idea of his mixed breeds, which is what we were looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Christine E. Nims

customer_reviews.title: Enlightening
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd test on this troublesome dog. And this one pretty much confirms the 1st. The 2nd test must have been contaminated. The test results mean I will never again rescue a puppy from Oklahoma...a pitbull/Australian cattle dog who hates other dogs and cannot be trusted around strangers. There's plenty of other things in there but just those 2 are enough to explain his behavior.
customer_reviews.author: Elsie's Nana

customer_reviews.title: Detailed
customer_reviews.text: This test is very detailed. It broke down my rescue dog's profile into 7 specific breeds. We were also able to clarify his primary breed as Australian sheperd. Some of the paperwork the rescue agency gave to us did indicate him as this breed, but other paperwork indicated him as a German pinscher. Our dog has absolutely no pinscher in him according to this dna test! Now we actually know what to tell people when they ask what breed our dog really is!
customer_reviews.author: Sof

customer_reviews.title: So neat to also be able to connect with our pups relatives!
customer_reviews.text: We adopted our sweet dog from China and were curious what breed she might be (she looks like a miniature Golden Retriever). We had heard from other folks they're bred smaller in China so when she came back 100% Golden we were excited. Even cooler we found she has other relatives rescued from China & now in the USA as well. Highly recommend to not only anyone interested in finding your pups breed but also connecting with relatives of your pup!
customer_reviews.author: John Allen

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I like many things about this product, SO FAR. It arrived the day after I ordered it. It was easy to open. The directions are very simple, easy to understand and follow. Sending it back was very easy. I do not have my results yet. When the results come back, I'll know if I like the product over all. (hence the low rating on 'accuracy' and 'value'.)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doggy Heritage Test
customer_reviews.text: This was worth every penny. We received our dog's health and heritage results quickly and the reports features are printable for our vet. Couldn't be happier with this purchase. Thank you Embark!
customer_reviews.author: LM Meier

customer_reviews.title: Quick and accurate
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one because reviews for other brands said they were unreliable. The results came within 3-4 weeks. They kept me informed of the status through receipt and test results. My dog is a mixed breed. I did not give them any pix or info about her that would help identify the breed. End result is she is 30% pit bull and the rest a mix of 5 other breeds. She looks like a pit so I think the results were accurate. Got her at the pound. They said she was a lab mix. There is 15% or less lab in her. Does not change how I feel about the dog. Was just curious.
customer_reviews.author: D. Palermo

customer_reviews.title: My rescue fur baby is 100% German Shepherd.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the short time in which the results were emailed to me. I adopted a German Shepherd from a rescue and I wondered if he was a mix because, to me, he undersized for a male. I did not have a photo to send to Embark so I am confident the results are accurate. I received the results that my fur baby is 100% German Shepherd. Not that I'd love him any less if he were mixed, but now I am certain.
customer_reviews.author: ReBecca

customer_reviews.title: If it looks like a Jack, swims like a Jack, and barks like a Jack.....,
customer_reviews.text: From veterinary staff to friends, family members & strangers - whenever they saw Molly (who is now 13 yrs old - they would say, "that dog has some Jack Russell in her..." Embark results showed no Jack Russell whatsoever! Molly's brother looked just like her. I honestly have no confidence in their results and would not recommend Embark to anyone. I wish I had kept my money and kept saying people she was a Jack Russell / Dachshund mix.
customer_reviews.author: claymore

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: The accuracy of this test is laughable. I did not include a picture with the swab when I sent it in as I simply wanted to see what the 'science' said. My daughter's puppy is supposed to be a border collie mix but I wanted to see what else is there because she definitely isn't even half border collie. Embark says she is a labrador retriever and american eskimo dog mix. That's a joke. Will be trying again with a different test.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Not sure
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to get the results back as both of my doggies were adopted from the SPCA. I really believed my Snickers (brown and white dog) was at least SOME jack russell, his results don’t seem to match. I included a pic of my other dog Molly, I am wondering if they got the results mixed up?? I guess we will see once I get hers back. I’m a little disappointed. UPDATE: I got my other dogs results and they seem to be true to what she looks like. I just don’t know about my other one. Disappointed ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Meghann Fontano

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Expensive and inaccurate. Can not recommend. You make the call, they claim this dog is 100% American pit bull. You ever see a pit bull run like that? You ever see a pit bull with long muscular legs, long toes, deep chest, and a thin waist that runs like a sight hound and can jump up on a 3 foot tall counter top from a standstill? Yeah, us neither. Then when we called them the guy on the phone wanted to argue about it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hetzler

customer_reviews.title: I don't believe it is accurate
customer_reviews.text: Our new rescue dog has all the appearance of an English Pointer, though a bit small (35 pounds). Our vet commented on her being a pointer mix. The test revealed NO pointer ancestry at all. Australian cattle dog, Australian shepherd, pit bull, Labrador retriever and a bit of Great Pyranees. None of which have her distinctive Pointer-like markings. All in all, it doesn't matter. We adore our dog, whatever she is. But I wouldn't use their service again.
customer_reviews.author: Giametti

customer_reviews.title: Cool features
customer_reviews.text: It was interesting to see what my dog was. The results seem accurate and I like the way the results are laid out online. The family tree feature was my favorite because I was able to learn what my dogs parents and grandparents were. There’s also a feature to find doggy family members. We found my dogs cousin who was born the same place in Mexico where my dog had been found.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I found out everything about my dog from the health problems he may have to exactly where he came from! Everything about his parents and siblings and relatives! Exactly what the best types of food for him are and what his allergies may be. This is a great product AND you have the option of letting them use your dogs DNA to help research medical issues that dogs have. Definitely easy to use, it comes with a big q-tip and you swab your dogs cheek for a few seconds then put that q-tip in a vial and send it off and wait! Very easy and fun plus you are possibly helping advance cancer research and other health research!
customer_reviews.author: Dion Tieman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use - fun results
customer_reviews.text: This test was simple to use, it had easy to follow directions. The website sends updates as the receive and process the sample. Then once you get your results back there is thorough and easy to read information about the traits of the breeds that make up your dog. It even offers connections to other dogs who may related, and continues to do so as other results come in and match to yours.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: They do a good job of keeping you updated through the testing process. My dog's results, while not what we expected, did actually make sense! The surprise was 20.4% Siberian Husky which she ZERO physical traits of but she communicates exactly like huskies do so it made so much sense!! Haha. All in all this was such a fun experience and I would totally do it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seemingly innacurate.
customer_reviews.text: Results are 50 percent Rottweiler, 44 percent American Bully and 6 percent American Staffordshire Terrier. Don't know how these results are anywhere close to accurate except the Staffordshire Terrier. edit: They did respond to questions and give thorough responses explaining how they reached conclusions, but I definitely doubt their sample pool used for their algorithm. So will bump up to a 2 star for good customer service. Plan on trying a competitor next Christmas to see how they compare.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan

customer_reviews.title: PERFECTLY awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to check on my rescue pup is we thought was mostly German Shepard. But she looked like she had some wolf in her, and this tested those DNA stains. Turns out she is 3rd generation 100% German Shepard - which was awesome to see. Came with many interesting facts that my vet was glad to receive. This is a wonderful test to see what your rescue pup is, and what health markers they may have. Will help educate you to care for your fur-baby the best way possible for a long and healthy life. worth the money and time spent.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanine

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: We used 2 dog DNA kits: Wisdom Panel®️ and Embark®️ We weren’t quite sure of Wisdom Panel results so we tried Embark. We recommend both kits, but prefer Embark over Wisdom Panel for their thoroughness. Embark is more expensive but you get a more-detailed, general result. Embark’s results took 5 weeks, Wisdom Panel’s took 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Wright

customer_reviews.title: Really neat!
customer_reviews.text: We adopted a pit bill mix 9 month old. He actually did not look pit, so we decided to have his DNA done. The results were great. 48% American pit, 20% boxer, 13% American Staffordshire Terrior, 10% lab and 9% German Shepard. This was really fun and love having this information. I rounded the numbers. Embark gives you the exact percentage.
customer_reviews.author: Kase

customer_reviews.title: Accurate dog breed discovery
customer_reviews.text: We recently rescued a mixed breed puppy and used this test to get to know him better since he doesn’t look like any specific breed. The test came back with six different breeds and showed very different results than our vet’s or our assumption.
customer_reviews.author: Sena Zorlu

customer_reviews.title: Very fast results
customer_reviews.text: This product was great. Not only did it tell me about my dog's dna but it showed me dogs shes related to of people that have used this kit. I still get updates if someone new does it and they're dog is a close match to ours. I would highly recommend this to someone with a dog who wants to know their genetic makeup. The only thing I wish is that they did it for cats because I had a friend ask me about that for her 3 cats.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn Rowe

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT!!
customer_reviews.text: I am sooo happy I did this kit for my rescue puppy! The genetic breakdown of his breed would have been enough for what I paid for (I knew he was at least 50% shepherd but couldn't figure out what else) BUT the part I loved the most was seeing that it shows like 5 likely related dogs that also took the test.. I found 2 of his sisters and his dads new parents also did the test and I got to see pictures of them and read little bios about them. 15/10 would definitely recommend for the family reunion photos alone!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Kept me informed of progress
customer_reviews.text: I did my research, decided that this would be the best test. What I did not expect was how well Embark would keep me informed about progress of my sample and results. I mailed using the post paid provided envelope with tracking number. Embark kept me informed via email of when the post office received my sample, when Embark received it, when testing was started and how long it might take. I received results within the time they said I would. The results look right on target too.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Customer service made it worthwhile.
customer_reviews.text: This test did not tell me anything I did not already know. Traits and diseases were all written as “probably not”. For the money to examine his DNA I could have written it. At least they got his breed right. Save your money. Just ask your vet question or research the breed yourself. Additionally, I contacted the company who sent me the information I was looking for. So maybe I judged them too quickly. If you’re interested give them a chance.
customer_reviews.author: D. Silver

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy, Wait for the Sales
customer_reviews.text: Loved to see the breed breakdown for our rescue pup! Really clear directions, even though my dog didn’t love the cheek swab I got a good sample. Really liked the email updates along the way about progress towards the final results. Would absolutely recommend to all friends and family. But wait for the sale price!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Great Dog Breed ID
customer_reviews.text: I do know now what my pup's breed is. This is easy to use and they keep you updated through the whole process.
customer_reviews.author: girleygirl555

customer_reviews.title: Results were puzzling
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use test. Embark was good with communication and updates. Results in about 4 weeks. The results themselves were a bit puzzling, and didn't really clear up the mystery of my rescue dog's breed. My dog is 50% what I thought she might be, and 50% a breed that bears no resemblance to her at all. I was hoping for more clarity, but was left with a shrug. Interesting experiment I guess that at least confirmed some of my suspicions.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Great breed and health Information!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve done tests for each of my rescue dogs and it’s so cool getting information about what their mix breed profile is. It’s helpful to understand behavior and traits. I really appreciate the health screening part of the testing too. My first rescue dog had a neurological condition and it’s so helpful to be prepared through the testing or to have peace of mind knowing your dog is clear of all the conditions Embark screens for. I’ve been telling all my friends and sharing my dog’s report. I chose Embark because of the company’s reputation for accuracy and their association with Cornell. I wanted the most reliable test available.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best dog DNA kit
customer_reviews.text: This was a perfect way to find out what breed our border collie mix is. Just swab the cheek of the mouth as instructed and return the swab to Embark in their prepaid box and then wait for results. It is easy to use and the results are awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Went for this one because it had the best ratings. I too can confirm that this company is awesome. Once the lab received the swab it took about 12 days to get the results back. Super fun to finally see what all made up our mutt and were surprised at some of the results! Do keep in mind if you want to see health conditions and traits it’s an additional $99 to upgrade and see that. For us we just wanted to see the different breeds.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Fascinating
customer_reviews.text: I was always told my dog is a black mouth cur, lab mix. He is the furthest thing from it according to Embark. It's so wild! I loved learning about my dog's family tree and the genetic diseases he (thankfully) doesn't have. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: K.Lou

customer_reviews.title: Good experience
customer_reviews.text: I just got DNA results for my beloved mixed breed, Rudy. Service from this company has been very good. Test was easy to use, results came relatively fast, and the results were fun and easy to read. I did some research beforehand that pointed me in the direction of this company over competitors, and I'm glad I made the choice I did. Bonus: With results, I get to see some of Rudy's relatives! Interesting.
customer_reviews.author: AJP

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate/somewhat accurate
customer_reviews.text: It was a little accurate. We knew our dog had either pit or American bulldog. It hit the pit, but we also wanted to know about his markings, the spots, the long curly tail. None of the other "markers" could identify this. He is a large dog but had had more little dog marks. Was interesting to know that he had more "wolfness" than normal. Overall I wish had saved the money. They told what we kinda already knew.
customer_reviews.author: Heather S

customer_reviews.title: Most accurate DNA test to date.
customer_reviews.text: Compared to wisdom or some of the cheaper tests embark checks 200,000 genetic markers for your dog and is probably the most accurate dna test publicly available. only downside it takes 2-6 weeks depending on how busy the labs are. It only took 3 weeks for myself though! For the life of us we could not figure out what our mutt was, well obviously there was no way! she's so split on everything! Very satisfied with my dogs results and could not be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Lyndon

customer_reviews.title: Can’t make an accurate review yet
customer_reviews.text: After three weeks of being at the lab for testing. They said that something rare happened at the lab and the test failed. They did send out another swab for free. So I’m curious if this happened to others, and if I will ever get the results
customer_reviews.author: susan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, detailed results
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my girlfriend's rescue dog and I was very surprised at how specific the results were. The kit was very easy to use. The most difficult part was swabbing the dog's mouth but we eventually got it to work. When my girlfriend adopted her dog they told her he was a Shepard mix but we were curious to see what that mix was. This test definitely gave us that answer. Some of the results are a little surprising but the company does a good job explaining it all.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Parmer

customer_reviews.title: Slow and completely inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Took FOREVER to get results for our pup who’s mom we know is a Great Pyrenees but we weren’t sure of the mix. They just gave us the same random pitbull chowchow mix I’ve seen a bunch of people get. Womp womp. Didn’t even say he was the one breed we know he has in him
customer_reviews.author: J.C.

customer_reviews.title: different bully breeds distinguished
customer_reviews.text: I loved that it distinguishes between the different bully breeds not like wisdom panal.
customer_reviews.author: kristi stibbe

customer_reviews.title: Very informative
customer_reviews.text: Got the results yesterday, one of the breeds was a surprise, they rest we had mostly guessed. The directions are easy to follow. My dog wasn’t a fan of having the swab in his mouth, but we got it done. I love the emails that the send when the sample is being processed. They explain what the scientists are doing. I have already recommended this brand to others!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah FR

customer_reviews.title: Interesting results!
customer_reviews.text: Well, that was unexpected. Sort of. We knew he was Australian Cattle Dog (blue heeler), but thought the rest was border collie and maybe something else to explain his short stature. Results were 50% blue heeler, 30% chihuahua, 12% Brittany, and the rest “supermutt”. Wasn’t expecting chihuahua, but he’s definitely a Super Mutt! Results came in quicker than expected at about 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: kdsale

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.text: Everyone always asks me what my dog is and now I have the answer...41% Australian Cattle Dog, 25% Miniature Schnauzer, 25% Chihuahua, and only 9% undefined (but probably some Chow Chow and Collie). The report was remarkably detailed and explained so much about my dogs behavior. I am so happy I invested in getting this information.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Smith

customer_reviews.title: Simply the Best DNA Test
customer_reviews.text: The process was very easy and quick! The results were completed within about two weeks and explained a lot of things about our dog Tucker. It is fun to see relatives and mix matches, we found a few dogs that looked identical to him. Definitely way more accurate than Wisdom Panel and they are always improving.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Lam

customer_reviews.title: Accurate Results and many other benefits!
customer_reviews.text: I did quite a bit of research before purchasing this test. I had read it was the most accurate. It was perfectly accurate! I was told my dog was a Shih Poo and I knew it wasn’t true. I found out she was a Chi Poo Pomeranian Miniature Pincher Yorkshire Terrier Cocker Spaniel! It led me to other dogs who shared similar DNA and I could see the resemblance. The vet agreed with the results and her personality matches the DNA profile. Results are accurate and their are many other benefits on the website like training for your breed, feeding him or her and understanding their behavior.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Legend

customer_reviews.title: So worth it
customer_reviews.text: Soooo worth it. My boyfriend adopted a puppy and all we knew was that the mom was a pit bull. We assumed she had boxer in her or maybe bull mastiff and we were so wrong. It was so interesting seeing her breed make up and the app even tells you possible relatives. One of the dogs shared over 30% dna and looks just like the pups mom and lives in the same city as us. The app allows you to reach out to dogs with similar dna profiles it’s amazing
customer_reviews.author: savanna carl

customer_reviews.title: Title
customer_reviews.text: You can probably get a dna test from your vet for $50. They take about the same time to get results. With this, you can view the results online once the tests are complete
customer_reviews.author: Larka_etherin

customer_reviews.title: Adopted dog turns out to be purebred!
customer_reviews.text: I did the DNA test on my 3 year old rescued dog. I knew he had pitbull in him but was wondering what else he could be mixed with. It was surprising to me when he came out 100% American Pitbull Terrier! They break everything down nicely and they had no idea what my dog looked like so there was no way that they knew he looked like a pit. Would definitely recommend this brand over some of your cheaper kits.
customer_reviews.author: Allison L.

customer_reviews.title: Very detailed results!
customer_reviews.text: Collecting the DNA sample was very easy and not uncomfortable for my dog. The results arrived much sooner than promised. My dog is a VERY mixed breed, and the results for the 2 primary breeds were not unexpected. Some of the others were a bit of a surprise, but not all breed characteristics are expressed in mixed breeds. The detail of results is impressive!
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Extensive testing
customer_reviews.text: This was fantastic! Valuable health information and a full report to share with my vet. I gave no info and no photos and did not know my dogs breed, only had some guesses so it was great to find out and I trust the results. It is really amazing what they can do :)
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Squitieri

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I knew the test results were correct because her moms breed come back exactly to what she was. When I seen what her dad was, this explains her!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Everything it claims to be
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this test is everything it claims to be. Collecting the sample was simple but waiting for the results was agonizing (it only took 26 days). When trying to choose between Embark and Wisdom, the deciding factor was the DNA matches of Embark. It’s the canine version of Ancestry and it is fascinating!
customer_reviews.author: PennyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Happy to now know!
customer_reviews.text: Very, very happy with Embark! The results were clear concise; it was a ton of fun to read the results on Christmas Day. I got one for myself, my daughter and my son. It actually gave more information than I thought it would... So happy to now know what my adopted dog from Georgia really is!!
customer_reviews.author: 4violet

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it!
customer_reviews.text: We now know what our rescue pup is! Without a doubt this test is completely accurate! Also, they have a cute video that tells the results or you can play a guessing game. Super fun, interactive, and an awesome experience. We submitted ours after Thanksgiving and got the results the day after Christmas. Definitely worth the buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun gift for a rescue mutt mom!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect Christmas gift for my mom who always wondered what breed our Rescue pup is! Results came sooner than the given anticipated date. Results came back with a small % of “super mutt” so if your dog is heavily mixed, don’t expect a miracle. Cheek Swab is easy to use- getting your dog to cooperate is the hard part. This has value for the money for us because it made my mom so happy but I waited for the Black Friday discount.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina & Cy

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love that they send you email updates to let you know what’s happening. I feel like my results were correct and that for the price this is a solid test !
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: Was really cool to find out what all was in my girl always said she was Sheppard husky mix floored to find out not completely right she's actually a Chow Malamute + Sheppard Lab mix LoL 😂
customer_reviews.author: jeannie

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This was so much fun! We had been wondering for years what breed my dog was. Now we know!! I was shocked by the results. The report is so detailed and really interesting. Our results were back in 2-3 weeks instead of the longer quoted time. I highly recommend! Excellent customer service! Great website!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Goss

customer_reviews.title: glad i bought it
customer_reviews.text: was 99.00 at christmas. i didn't give embark any info about my rescue dog but i feel confident with the results that they gave me although not the mixture i was expecting it still seems accurate. and it took less than 3 weeks from the time it was sent in. i am happy i did it.
customer_reviews.author: mark d.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use and Quick Arrival
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I decided to invest in identifying the breed of my fur child. I also am glad that I upgraded to the medical history as well, as I have a few important things to share with the vet, which could potentially prolong my dog's life. It's also fun to get updates and pictures of my dog's "cousins".
customer_reviews.author: Kelli M Williams

customer_reviews.title: Loved this!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 12 year old as a Christmas present for his rescued dog! Super easy! Super fun! Super accurate! Mommy was right! KT is a Boston terrier/chihuahua!
customer_reviews.author: Kandikane57

customer_reviews.title: Doubt the accuracy of the test
customer_reviews.text: The dog in question looks a lot like a Norfolk Terrier, with something else mixed in. The results came back with only a small percentage of terrier in her and other dogs that don't look anything like her in the predominant portion of her DNA. At least they were all small dogs (she is 10 pounds). Based on what I received, I have serious doubts as to the accuracy of the test.
customer_reviews.author: Steve L. LeGardeur

product_meta.title: Embark | Dog DNA Test | Breed Identification Kit
feature_bullets: BREED DISCOVERY: Embark screens for over 350 dog breeds, types, and varieties. Using a research-grade genotyping platform developed in partnership with Cornell University College of Veterinary Medicine, Embark offers the most accurate breed breakdown on the market.

MOST ACCURATE: In mixed breed dogs, Embark can precisely detect breed contributions down to 5% of the total breed make. This makes Embark’s product more than twice as precise as other tests on the market that can only detect breed contributions of 12% or more.

DISCOVER YOUR DOG’S RELATIVES: Find and connect with other dogs that share DNA with yours. Only Embark will give you a percentage of shared DNA between your dog and others that have been tested with Embark. Doggy DNA Relative Finder included with purchase.
FAST & EASY: Simple cheek swab. Results generally available online in 3-5 weeks.

UPGRADE ANYTIME: Solved your breed mystery but now want to know if your pup is at risk for 175+ genetic health conditions? Upgrade your Embark account at any time to get your dog's genetic health report — no additional swabs or kits needed. Upgrade equivalent to buying the Embark Breed + Health kit.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
